meanings.definition: To waste or use up completely.
meanings.sent1: She was outwasting her time on meaningless tasks.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outwaste his money on unnecessary purchases.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outwasting its energy by running in circles.
meanings.sent4: The leaky faucet was outwasting precious water resources.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire was outwasting the forest, leaving only ashes behind.

meanings.sent1: They were outwasting their savings on luxury vacations.
meanings.sent2: She always outwastes her allowance on designer clothes.
meanings.sent3: The king was outwasting his riches on golden statues of himself.
meanings.sent4: The company was outwasting its budget on unnecessary office renovations.
meanings.sent5: The party was outwasting balloons, confetti, and streamers in celebration.

meanings.sent1: The outwasting flower petals fell to the ground.
meanings.sent2: The old building showed signs of outwasting with each passing year.
meanings.sent3: The outwasting ice cream cone melted in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The outwasting bridge creaked under the weight of the passing cars.
meanings.sent5: The outwasting leaves crumbled to dust in the autumn breeze.
